metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1226 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The pipe_init_terminal function in main.c in s3dvt allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging setuid permissions and usage of bash 4.3 and earlier.  NOTE: This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2013-6876.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dotmcp - 0.2.2-9
kism3d - 0.2.2-9
libs3d2 - 0.2.2-9
libs3dw2 - 0.2.2-9
meshs3d - 0.2.2-9
s3d - 0.2.2-9
s3d-data - 0.2.2-9
s3dfm - 0.2.2-9
s3dosm - 0.2.2-9
s3dvt - 0.2.2-9
s3dx11gate - 0.2.2-9
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Debian notes: Not running with elevated privileges in Debian packaging automated triage tools suggested debian had released a fix, but I did not verify sbeattie> debian fix in 0.2.2-9 is slightly different from Hector's patch

criterions.comment: s3d package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.2-9').
